analysis.purpose: To share a movie recommendation and critique of the financial crisis
analysis.significance: Documentary analysis of the 2008 financial crisis and systemic corruption in financial systems

concerns: lack of legal sanction for financial misconduct

notable_quotes: "The betrayal of public trust and collective values that Mr. Ferguson chronicles was far more brazen and damaging than the adultery in Nathaniel Hawthorne's novel"
"Some investment bankers — at Goldman Sachs in particular — were betting against the positions they were pushing on their customers"
"Markets are not like tectonic plates, shifting on their own. Visible hands write laws and make deals"
red_flags: Conflicts of interest in academia and government
Lack of accountability for financial crisis

details: New York Times film review by A. O. Scott

analysis.summary: Email forwarding a New York Times review of the documentary 'Inside Job' which critically examines the 2008 financial crisis, systemic corruption in financial systems, and lack of accountability for those responsible.
